title: The Cardinals really lost? The Eagles and Rams, too? Barnwell on three embarrassing Week 5 letdowns
content: We saw blown leads, bad turnovers, tough calls and one of the weirdest TDs you'll see all season. Let's stack three head-scratching losses from NFL Week 5.

title: Questions, takeaways off every game: Patriots shock Bills; Bucs and Titans win thrillers
content: NFL Nation reporters answer the biggest questions out of each game. Here's what we learned in Week 5.

title: Sanchez now facing felony charge for altercation
content: Mark Sanchez is facing a felony battery charge over the altercation between the former NFL quarterback and a 69-year-old truck driver early Saturday in Indianapolis.

title: Murray: Cards shocker 'How to Lose a Game 101'
content: QB Kyler Murray didn't know what to think after the Cardinals' 22-21 defeat to the lowly Titans -- a game that Arizona led 21-3 but that was ultimately derailed by two botched plays in the fourth quarter.

title: Maye leads win as Diggs shines in Buffalo return
content: New England quarterback Drake Maye delivered a "gutty performance" down the stretch, and wide receiver Stefon Diggs was sensational in an emotional return to Buffalo, as the Patriots shocked the Bills in prime time Sunday.

title: Harbaugh sticking with DC Orr after latest defeat
content: Ravens coach John Harbaugh said he's sticking with defensive coordinator Zach Orr following Sunday's 44-10 loss to the Texans, the latest defensive meltdown in a season that continues to spiral for Baltimore.

title: J-Rod 2B gives M's 1st home playoff win since '01
content: Outfielder Julio Rodriguez hit a tiebreaking RBI double in the eighth inning, and the Mariners outlasted the Detroit Tigers 3-2 in Game 2 of their AL Division Series on Sunday night, giving Seattle its first home playoff victory since Oct. 15, 2001.

title: Bruins to retire No. 33 of former captain Chara
content: Zdeno Chara, captain of the 2011 Stanley Cup champs, will become the Bruins' 13th player to have his number retired when his No. 33 is honored Jan. 15.

title: Panthers' Dowdle eyes Dallas after career game
content: After he rushed for 206 yards in the Panthers' comeback win, Rico Dowdle had a message for the Cowboys, Carolina's next opponent and his former team: "They got to buckle up."

title: Pete Carroll processing Raiders' 1-4 start 'poorly'
content: Pete Carroll expected to win right away with the Raiders, but instead Las Vegas is 1-4, and the coach said he's processing that fact "poorly."

title: Where Penn State, Texas go from here and other key developments in Week 6
content: How bleak are things for Penn State and Texas? What's next in the ACC and Big 12? Bill Connelly has answers.

title: 'Beyond repair': Napheesa Collier, Cathy Engelbert and a WNBA teetering on the brink
content: Amid the WNBA Finals, two of the most powerful people in the game are locked in a contentious battle -- for public opinion, power and money.

title: Never-before-seen history? A battle of villains?! The best World Series matchup for every type of fan
content: We're down to eight teams. Here's what Fall Classic matchup you should be pulling for if your squad isn't playing in October.

title: How the Dodgers fixed Roki Sasaki -- and possibly saved their World Series repeat hopes
content: After a disastrous MLB debut, L.A.'s new ninth-inning man has unleashed jaw-dropping stuff in October.

title: Are the Jaguars expecting too much of WR/CB Travis Hunter ... or not enough?
content: Many have criticized how the Jaguars are using the rookie two-way threat, but the team has stuck to its plan.

title: 'He let Patrick into his world': Inside the decision that's fueling the Chiefs' dynasty
content: Getting Patrick Mahomes changed the Chiefs' fortunes. But another draft day move helped ensure lasting success.

title: A Travis Hunter on every NFL team? 32 players who could be two-way threats
content: The Jaguars rookie plays both wide receiver and cornerback. We found other versatile players across the league.

title: Breaking down the top goalie masks across the NHL for the upcoming season
content: Want to know what mask your favorite goalie is wearing this season? We present our goalie mask guide.

title: Early NBA trade guide: Two timelines, superstar futures and apron issues
content: Closing championship windows, new front offices and wild-card teams all highlight Bobby Marks' early NBA trade preview.

title: Don't know which UWCL team to support? We can help
content: The UEFA Women's Champions League now has 18 teams, but which should you root for? Current champions Arsenal? Pass masters Barcelona? Winning machine OL Lyonnes? Or someone else?

title: The VAR Review: Should Arsenal's penalty have been overturned? Plus, Man United's spot-kick escape
content: Should Arsenal's penalty against West Ham have been cancelled? What happened with Sunderland's overturned spot kick at Manchester United?

title: Lamine Yamal is key for Barcelona and Spain, but is he headed for burnout?
content: The teenager is the natural heir to Lionel Messi and Cristiano Ronaldo, but he's played a lot at a young age.

title: Week 5 fantasy football winners and losers: Taylor, Egbuka, Dowdle shine
content: Key running backs and an outstanding rookie seized opportunities in a high-scoring set of games in Week 5, but two of fantasy's most reliable stars didn't get the job done.

title: Miami dominance and a UCLA stunner: Recapping a chaotic Week 6
content: In Week 6, the Grim Reaper came for Penn State and Texas, but Miami proved itself against Florida State.

title: NFL draft risers, questions and notes: What to make of Nico Iamaleava, Carson Beck in this QB class
content: Does Nico Iamaleava fit into the 2026 class? Could Miami stack first-rounders? We have updates on NFL prospects through CFB Week 6.

title: Singapore shows McLaren's management of title rivals will only get harder
content: Another flash point between Lando Norris and Oscar Piastri showed McLaren's ordeal in managing its drivers.

title: MLS Power Rankings: Philly wins Shield, red-hot LAFC rolling
content: After clinching the Supporters' Shield, there can be no question who's on top of ESPN's MLS Power Rankings: the Philadelphia Union.

title: After regaining the light heavyweight belt at UFC 320, Alex Pereira should move to heavyweight
content: Now that Pereira is a champ again, the UFC should give the fans the heavyweight blockbuster they want.

title: Eric Karabell's 'Do not draft' list, including LaMelo Ball, Ja Morant, Joel Embiid
content: Eric Karabell highlights the players to fade at their current average draft position in fantasy basketball drafts.

title: Draft guide: All you need to win your league this season
content: We've got everything you need to help you prepare for and execute a successful draft, all in one place.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal tracking Juventus star Yildiz
content: Arsenal remain hopeful of signing Juventus forward Kenan Yildiz in the future. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Bihar: NDA vs MGB & the 'PK factor' - who has edge in 'mother of all elections'
content: Bihar gears up for assembly elections, announced by the Election Commission for November 6 and 11. The NDA, led by JD(U) and BJP, faces a united opposition under RJD's Tejashwi Yadav. New entrant Jan Suraaj, led by Prashant Kishor, also aims to contest all 243 seats, setting the stage for a multi-cornered contest.

title: 'Outright appalling': PM on BJP leaders being attacked in Bengal; targets TMC
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi condemned the attack on BJP leaders in flood-hit West Bengal, calling it "outright appalling" and accusing the ruling TMC of violence instead of disaster relief. BJP MP Khagen Murmu and MLA Sankar Ghosh were attacked by a mob, with Murmu sustaining facial injuries.

title: Bihar polls decoded: Meet the key players — what's at stake
content: Bihar's assembly elections, scheduled for November 6 and 11, are poised to be a make-or-break moment for several key political figures. Nitish Kumar faces a legacy-defining test, while Tejashwi Yadav aims for the chief minister's post. Rahul Gandhi's leadership and Congress's revival are on trial.

title: Can Gaza peace plan get Trump the Nobel on Oct 10?
content: At the UN, he declared that “everyone says I should get the Nobel Peace Prize.” Behind closed doors, his envoy Steve Witkoff has been nudging European counterparts; Marco Rubio has been reminding allies; and Pfizer’s Albert Bourla has even chimed in, praising Operation Warp Speed as Nobel-worthy. The entire MAGA machine has turned into a PR agency for peace — peace, of course, defined by Trump himself.

title: H-1B visa fee hike: Why global tech startups outside US are ‘happy’ with new rules
content: New US H-1B visa rules are shifting global tech talent. Companies in the UK and Canada are now attracting skilled engineers. This presents a significant advantage for these international tech hubs. Founders and political leaders recognize this opportunity. Demand for relocation services is surging. This trend is reshaping the landscape for top engineering professionals.

title: India’s oil consumption to surpass all by 2050! 5.4m to 9.1m bpd rise predicted
content: India's oil consumption is projected to lead globally by 2050, reaching 9.1 million barrels per day due to robust economic growth, according to BP’s chief economist Spencer Dale.  Natural gas demand will also nearly double.  While renewables are growing, coal will remain significant, though its share will decrease in a decarbonization scenario.

title: 'Bigg Boss is tougher than cricket' – Ind pacer joins Salman Khan show; stuns fans
content: Cricket star Deepak Chahar's surprise appearance on Bigg Boss fueled wildcard entry rumors. Interacting with host Salman Khan, Chahar joked about the show's challenges. However, his visit was to support his sister, Malti Chahar, the season's second wildcard. Deepak's charismatic presence, including a playful cricket session with Salman, delighted fans.

title: Bihar poll dates: Elections to be held in 2 phases on Nov 6 & 11; result on Nov 14
content: The Election Commission of India (ECIannounced the Bihar assembly polls schedule. New guidelines will ensure smoother voting. Polling stations will limit voters. Officials will carry identity cards. Mobile phones can be deposited outside. Webcasting will be complete. EVM ballot papers will feature candidate photos. The election will be a direct contest between NDA and Mahagathbandhan. Political activity will intensify.

title: 'Bring back this YouTube channel': Donald Trump to Google; 'not fair for Republicans'
content: Former President Donald Trump urged Google to reinstate Univision on YouTube TV, arguing its removal harms Republicans ahead of the Midterm elections.  YouTube stated negotiations are ongoing, citing Univision's unrealistic demands and low viewership on their platform, despite the broadcaster's large subscriber base elsewhere.

title: Big news! Rishabh Pant eyes comeback – Back in Ranji Trophy
content: Rishabh Pant is nearing a comeback to competitive cricket, with a potential Ranji Trophy return in late October. The BCCI medical team will assess his recovery this week, with clearance possible by October 10. Pant has expressed his desire to play for Delhi, subject to fitness and BCCI approval, aiming for matches from October 25.

title: Arattai launch: Anand Mahindra backs ‘Made in India’ app; Zoho founder replies
content: Zoho's homegrown messaging app, Arattai, recently gained immense popularity, topping Indian app stores as a "spyware-free, made-in-India" alternative. Industrialist Anand Mahindra publicly endorsed the app, prompting a grateful response from Zoho founder Sridhar Vembu. Despite its rapid rise, Arattai is currently addressing user-reported issues like OTP delays and call glitches.

title: Gold prices surge Rs 9,700! Hit fresh high of over Rs 1.3 lakh; what’s driving rally?
content: Gold rate today: Gold prices in Delhi hit a record high of Rs 1,30,300 per 10 grams on Monday, fueled by global safe-haven demand and a weaker rupee. Silver also saw substantial gains, reaching Rs 1,57,400 per kg. Analysts attribute the surge to investor confidence in bullion amidst economic uncertainties and a strong bullish trend.

title: UP horror: Man molests 14-yr-old girl in Meerut; arrested after video goes viral
content: A 14-year-old girl in Meerut was allegedly molested by Janu alias Jane Alam, who was arrested on Monday. While trying to escape police, he fell into a pit and fractured his arm. The incident, reportedly captured on CCTV, was reported by the girl’s mother on October 4. A case under BNS and POCSO Sections 7 and 8 has been registered.

title: Milwaukee Bucks vs Miami Heat Preseason Game 1: Prediction and odds
content: The Milwaukee Bucks and Miami Heat are set for an exciting preseason clash on October 6, 2025. With revamped rosters, the Bucks, led by Giannis Antetokounmpo and new additions like Myles Turner, are favored. The Heat, despite missing Tyler Herro, will rely on their defense. Betting odds suggest a close game, with the Bucks as slight underdogs.

title: Wayne Gretzky & Janet Jones’ love story: From dance fever to 30 years of marriage
content: Hockey legend Wayne Gretzky and Janet Jones' enduring love story began with a chance meeting in 1981, reigniting at a 1987 Lakers game. Their shared mindset led to a whirlwind romance, a "royal wedding" in 1988, and a family of five children. They prioritized family, making their decades-long marriage a true victory off the ice.

title: Chiefs heiress Gracie Hunt questions wellness after Austin health experience
content: Kansas City Chiefs heiress Gracie Hunt recently experienced an "eye-opening" holistic wellness assessment at Medici Health, Austin. This comprehensive check-up, spanning heart screenings to vision tests, profoundly highlighted the critical importance of proactive self-care before health issues emerge. Hunt lauded the compassionate team and the Phillips family's vision, advocating for health as a continuous, empowering journey for all.

title: Mark Kastelic charges at Rangers’ 6'9" Matt Rempe, refuses to flinch
content: Bruins' new forward Mark Kastelic charged Rangers' Matt Rempe in their final preseason game after both left the penalty box. This incident followed earlier physical plays and penalties, showcasing Kastelic's gritty character despite a significant size disadvantage. The fight, deemed a draw, highlighted Kastelic's readiness for tough bottom-six roles ahead of the Bruins' October 2025 season opener.

title: Controversies galore! How IND-PAK clash turned ugly: Death stare, bug attack & more
content: The India-Pakistan Women's World Cup clash was a high-voltage affair, beginning with captains skipping handshakes and a controversial toss. Play was briefly halted by a swarm of flies, adding to the unusual drama. Pakistan's chase featured a contentious run-out and a heated exchange involving Deepti Sharma. Here's a look at what all transpired in the group stage clash between the two rivals.

title: Vanessa Bryant melts hearts cuddling her puppy; calls herself 'proud dog mom'
content: Vanessa Bryant recently warmed hearts by sharing endearing photos and videos with her tiny white puppy on Instagram, playfully embracing her "dog mom" era. This isn't her first pet, as she also has a German Shepherd named Loki, continuing a long tradition of pet ownership and sharing moments of love and healing with her followers.

title: UAE: British teen dies in police chase months after release from Dubai prison
content: Marcus Fakana, a 19-year-old British teen who was jailed in Dubai for having a sexual relationship with a minor, has died in a car crash in London just three months after his release. Fakana had received a royal pardon in July 2025. The crash followed a police pursuit, and another man has been charged with causing his death.

title: 'Avoid actions that vitiate atmosphere': India tells B'desh; urges timely polls
content: India firmly backs free, fair, and inclusive elections in Bangladesh, urging their earliest possible conduct. Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri stated India will engage with any democratically elected government, emphasizing a pragmatic approach and the need for a conducive environment to strengthen bilateral ties. Global attention is on these upcoming polls.

title: NBA: Ayesha Curry praises husband Stephen's '17-year grind'
content: Ayesha Curry celebrated her husband Stephen Curry's 17th NBA season with an emotional Instagram post after the Golden State Warriors' preseason win. She revealed on a podcast that before meeting Stephen, she never envisioned marriage or motherhood, but their instant connection led her to embrace a life with him and their four children.

title: Meet the 2025 Nobel laureates in Physiology: Degrees and labs that shaped their careers
content: Mary E. Brunkow, Fred Ramsdell, and Shimon Sakaguchi received the 2025 Nobel Prize for their discoveries in peripheral immune tolerance. Sakaguchi identified regulatory T cells, while Brunkow and Ramsdell linked FOXP3 gene mutations to T-reg dysfunction, revolutionizing understanding of immune regulation and opening new therapeutic avenues for autoimmune diseases and cancer.

title: 'No kranti’: CM Sidda loses cool; snaps at minister, scribes
content: Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah lost his cool during a media interaction in Koppal, snapping over a misinterpreted question about a separate Lingayat religion, clarifying his non-official stance. He also expressed irritation regarding queries on government guarantees and dismissed "November Kranti," while discussing the ongoing caste census.

title: I knew my stomach pain was cancer, but doctors misdiagnosed: Nafisa Ali
content: Veteran actress Nafisa Ali Sodhi is courageously undergoing chemotherapy for a recurrence of stage 4 peritoneal cancer, after an initial misdiagnosis delayed treatment. She inspires many by openly sharing her journey on Instagram, advocating for a holistic approach to health, including fitness and mental well-being, as she continues her fight with grace.

title: Exclusive | ‘Came for basketball, now stuck in Japan’: Indian player’s struggle
content: Indian basketball prodigy Arvinder Singh left Punjab for Japan to play professionally, chasing a dream India’s inconsistent leagues couldn’t offer. Living alone, cooking his own meals, and navigating language barriers, he continues to hone his skills, even if it means risking a spot in India’s World Cup qualifiers. Hope for Indian hoops arrives with the country’s first professional league in 2026.

title: Nobel Prize: 3 scientists share Medicine award; breakthrough in peripheral immune tolerance
content: Mary E. Brunkow, Fred Ramsdell, and Shimon Sakaguchi have been awarded the 2025 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine for their discoveries concerning peripheral immune tolerance. Their work identified regulatory T cells, crucial for regulating the immune system and preventing autoimmune diseases. This groundbreaking research reshaped immunology, opening new avenues for treating autoimmune conditions and advancing cancer therapies.

title: IND vs AUS: AB de Villiers hails Abhishek Sharma; drops bold prediction
content: Cricket legend AB de Villiers predicts Indian opener Abhishek Sharma will excel in the upcoming Australia T20I series. Following his stellar Asia Cup performance, where he amassed 314 runs with a 200 strike rate, de Villiers believes the bouncy Australian pitches suit Sharma's aggressive style.

title: Kerala’s Right to Disconnect Bill: Switch off after work; career shield against burnout
content: Kerala plans a Right to Disconnect Bill for 2025. This bill protects private sector employees from after-hours work demands. Research suggests effective implementation needs clear rules and company policies. It also requires manager training and grievance committees. This initiative aims to improve employee well-being and productivity. The bill seeks to balance work and personal life.

title: Bronny James gets sweet birthday note from girlfriend Parker Whitfield
content: Bronny James celebrated his 21st birthday. His girlfriend Parker Whitfield shared a birthday wish. Bronny also thanked her on social media. This occurred after Bronny faced criticism for his recent basketball game performance. He scored 8.3 percent from the field. Bronny expressed satisfaction with his shots. His family and coach supported him.

title: Explosive outburst! Pak batter reprimanded after bat-smashing rant against India
content: Pakistan batter Sidra Amin received an ICC reprimand and a demerit point for breaching the Code of Conduct during the Women's World Cup match against India. Amin, who scored 81, hit her bat on the pitch after dismissal, violating Article 2.2 concerning abuse of cricket equipment. She accepted the charges, avoiding a formal hearing.

title: Bengal: BJP MP attacked while visiting flood-affected area; party blames TMC
content: BJP MP Khagen Murmu sustained serious head injuries after being attacked by locals with stones while visiting flood-affected areas in North Bengal. The incident occurred as he was overseeing relief operations, prompting the BJP to condemn the ruling TMC for targeting leaders engaged in humanitarian work amidst severe flooding and landslides.

title: Bad Bunny’s shift from LGBTQ+ ally to 2026 Super Bowl headliner
content: Bad Bunny's selection as Super Bowl 2026 headliner sparked immediate backlash on social media, with critics questioning his style and sexuality. Despite identifying as heterosexual, the artist faces accusations of "queerbaiting" for his gender-fluid expression. He dedicates this historic performance to his culture, actively fighting misogyny and homophobia, a crucial aspect often overlooked by U.S. audiences.

title: No impact of Trump pressure? Russia remains India’s main crude oil supplier; most economical option
content: India's crude oil imports from Russia slightly decreased in September but still comprised over one-third of its total acquisitions, with Russia remaining the top supplier. Despite US pressure, Russian barrels are crucial for Indian refiners due to their economic viability and embedded supply chains, ensuring their core position in India's import mix.

title: Nobel Medicine Prize: How three scientists found the body's peacekeepers
content: Your immune system is your body’s army. It fights off viruses, bacteria, and infections every day. Its elite soldiers are called T cells. Some T cells attack invaders directly, while others coordinate the fight like generals. But sometimes, the army makes a terrible mistake — it attacks its own country.

title: The sex scandal threatening ICC chief prosecutor Karim Khan's legacy
content: Khan, who issued unprecedented arrest warrants against Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and Defence Minister Yoav Gallant for war crimes in Gaza, is facing serious allegations of sexual misconduct made by a former aide. The timing of the allegations — surfacing soon after the Israeli warrants — has fuelled claims of political sabotage and divided international opinion over whether justice or geopolitics is on trial.

title: Riyadh Season 2025 kick-off: Opening parade, celebrity lineup, & top attractions
content: Riyadh Season 2025 officially kicks off on Friday, October 10, with a spectacular grand parade and six immersive entertainment zones. Featuring global stars, major sporting events like Six Kings Slam, and music festivals, the season promises diverse cultural experiences and thrilling adventures. Tickets start at SAR 25, offering fun for all ages.

title: Terror tag defied: Bishnoi gang carried out shootings at several locations in Canada; videos surface
content: The Lawrence Bishnoi gang, via Fateh Portugal, claimed responsibility for multiple shootings across Canada, targeting locations linked to Navi Tesi. They accused Tesi of extorting 5 million from singers in the gang's name. The group issued warnings against false accusations and spreading misinformation, emphasizing respect for honest individuals.

title: Taylor Swift’s ‘Fate of Ophelia’ video hides emotional tributes to Travis Kelce
content: Taylor Swift's new music video for “The Fate of Ophelia,” released on Travis Kelce’s birthday, serves as a heartfelt love letter to the NFL star. It features symbolic nods like Swift catching a football and entering room #87, alongside a hidden photo of Kelce. This visual tribute, part of her new album era, celebrates their relationship's journey.

title: Watch: Rowdy celebrates birthday inside Bengaluru prison; video goes viral
content: A viral video shows undertrial prisoner Gubbachhi Seena celebrating his birthday with cake and a large knife inside Bengaluru's Central Prison, prompting an ADGP inquiry. The celebration, recorded on a mobile phone, occurred months ago. Seena, accused of murder, had his rival's wife expose the clip. Police are now investigating mobile phone entry and facilitation of the event.

title: IND vs PAK: Deepti hits Pakistan batter with throw, gives death stares – Watch
content: India maintained their perfect Women's World Cup record, defeating Pakistan by 88 runs to extend their dominance to 12-0. The intense rivalry spilled onto the field with skipped handshakes, heated exchanges, and a controversial run-out. Deepti Sharma, involved in a clash with Sidra Amin, was ironically named best fielder. India now faces South Africa and Australia next.

title: Production, Quality And Distribution: Trifecta Behind Cough Syrup Deaths
content: Vats of chemicals being heated on gas stoves, plastic pipes oozing residue, rusted equipment and untrained workers - inspectors were in for a shock when they reached the premises where 'Coldrif' cough syrup was manufactured.

title: What's Next For France As Macron's Revolving Door Of PMs Spins Again?
content: French Prime Minister Sebastien Lecornu resigned on Monday, just hours after appointing his new cabinet, plunging France straight back into a political crisis it has been stuck in since 2022.

title: Mayawati Says "Will Contest Almost All Seats" In Bihar
content: Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP) chief Mayawati on Monday welcomed the announcement of assembly election for Bihar in two phases, and asserted that the party will contest almost all the seats on its own strength.

title: Video: Biker Loses Control And Disappears Under Cement Truck. He Survives
content: A video of an accident on a highway in Andhra Pradesh's Kakinada district has gone viral after a man on a motorcycle slipped and fell under a cement mixer truck - and survived it.

title: Advocate Who Threw Shoe At Chief Justice BR Gavai Suspended By Bar Council
content: The Bar Council of India (BCI) on Monday suspended advocate Rakesh Kishore with immediate effect after he attempted to attack Chief Justice of India (CJI) B.R. Gavai inside the Supreme Court.

title: Flight Ops Temporarily Suspended At Imphal Airport After Drone Sighting
content: Flight operations were temporarily suspended at the International airport in Imphal in Manipur, on Monday afternoon after a drone was sighted, raising security concerns, officials said.

title: 20-Year-Old Gaming Addict Kills Mother After Being Caught Stealing Jewellery
content: A 20-year-old man addicted to mobile phone gaming allegedly killed his 45-year-old mother in Lucknow after she caught him stealing her jewellery to repay his mounting debts from online betting losses, police said on Monday.

title: Pak Ships 1st Consignment Of Rare Earth Minerals To US: Report
content: Pakistan and the United States are entering a new phase in their economic and strategic partnership as both sides advance towards implementing an agreement for the export of rare earth minerals, Dawn reported.

title: Nitish Kumar Leads Chief Minister Race, Tejashwi Yadav 2nd: Opinion Poll
content: As the Election Commission of India (ECI) announced the schedule for the Bihar Legislative Assembly polls on Monday, with voting set for November 6 and 11 in two phases and counting on November 14.

title: Bypolls In 8 Assembly Seats Across 7 States To Be Held On November 11
content: The voting for assembly bypolls in eight constituencies in Jammu and Kashmir, Odisha, Jharkhand, Mizoram, Punjab, Telangana and Rajasthan will be held on November 11, Chief Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar announced on Monday.

title: Mobile Phones At Bihar Polling Booths? What Election Commission Said
content: Mobiles, which increasingly appear as an extension of a person, have often been a problem at polling stations. Not anymore, says the Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar, who found a way to accommodate it as he announced a set of new initiatives.

title: The 7 X Factors In Bihar Assembly Election 2025
content: Bihar faces a unique assembly election again. It is the first election to be held in the state after the Election Commission (EC) carried out the special intensive revision (SIR) exercise.

title: Navi Mumbai International Airport At A Glance: Capacity, Terminals, Amenities
content: The Navi Mumbai International Airport (NMIA) will be inaugurated by Prime Minister Narendra Modi on October 8.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Straight Talk: Just How Big Is The Effect Of Trump Tariffs On India?
content: Despite headline growth figures signalling resilience, India's informal sector, which employs hundreds of millions, remains exposed to external shocks and structural weaknesses.

title: Rescue Ops On As Several Missing In Bengal Floods, Death Count Rises To 28
content: The death count in the devastating landslides and floods in northern West Bengal rose to 28, as disaster management personnel continued the rescue operation with several people still missing and thousands of tourists stranded in cut-off hill pockets

title: Drunk Man Loses Phone, Lies It Was Robbed To Escape Wife's Anger
content: A man who complained about his mobile phone being snatched in Outer Delhi's Nangloi area was found to have cooked up the story to escape his wife's anger after losing it in a drunken state, police said on Monday.

title: Amid Cough Syrup Deaths, Kerala Bans All Medicines For Children Under 12 Without Prescription
content: The Kerala Health Department on Monday ordered that no medicines should be given to children under 12 without a doctor's prescription, a move taken in the wake of concerns over certain cough syrups.

title: "Time To Apologise, Accept Mistake": Kamal Haasan Visits Karur Stampede Site
content: It is "time to apologise, time to accept mistake", underlined Makkal Needhi Maiam chief Kamal Haasan on Monday as he visited the site of stampede at a TVK rally, fronted by Vijay, in Karur to meet the families of the victims.

title: 17 New Reforms In Bihar Polls That Will Be Implemented Across India
content: The Bihar polls for 243 assembly seats will be held in two phases: November 6 and 11. The votes will be counted on November 14.

title: FAQs: Bihar Assembly Election 2025
content: The people of Bihar will vote in two phases in their first assembly election after the Election Commission (EC) carried out the special intensive revision (SIR) exercise.

title: 400 SHG conservancy workers did not report to work, Greater Chennai Corporation contractor tells Madras High Court
content: Delhi MSW Solutions Limited says all 821 self-help group workers were given appointment letters; judges direct the organisation representing the workers to respond to the complaint

title: Mobile phone usage hinders children’s creativity, says expert
content: ‘Nowadays, many parents hand over mobile phones to their children to make them eat or stay occupied while they attend to their own work. This habit makes children addicted to mobile phones’

title: Supreme Court defers hearing on Vodafone-Idea plea against ₹9,450-crore AGR demand to October 13
content: Vodafone-Idea’s plea against DoT’s ₹9,450-crore AGR demand will now be heard on October 13, with the telecom major seeking waiver of interest and penalties

title: Crimes against elderly people on the rise in Kochi: NCRB
content: This marks a sharp increase from the 74 such incidents reported in 2022 and just 28 cases in 2021; chargesheeting rate for crimes against senior citizens in the city in 2023 is 74.5%

title: India, Australia set to ink defence declaration; focus on maritime security
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh’s upcoming visit to Australia underscores the growing momentum in the defence partnership and its pivotal role in ensuring stability across the Indo-Pacific, says official

title: Air India Express will reinstate withdrawn services from Kerala, says Chief Minister
content: Flights from the State to popular international routes will be reinstated in the winter schedule itself, AIE officials say at a meeting

title: Excise officials raid bar and restaurant in Ibrahimpatnam, seize 22,000 empty bottles
content: After busting spurious liquor racket in Annamayya district, simultaneous raids have been conducted on the illegal bottling unit run by accused A. Janardhana Rao, say Prohibition and Excise officials

title: Cough syrup tragedy: IMA protests against doctor’s arrest
content: The prescribing doctor has no way of knowing whether a medicine is contaminated until adverse outcomes are reported among patients who have taken it, the Indian Medical Association said in a statement

title: Governor Arlekar stresses role of education in social transformation at DUK convocation
content: He addressed the third convocation ceremony at the Digital University Kerala (DUK) in Thiruvananthapuram on Monday.

title: V-P Radhakrishnan to hold first meeting with leaders of parties on October 7
content: This will be the maiden meeting of the Vice-President with the leaders of the parties after he assumed charge as Rajya Sabha Chairman

title: Andhra Pradesh government gears up for Prime Minister’s visit to Kurnool on October 16
content: Ministers review arrangements, inspect possible venues; Payyavula Keshav says meeting will highlight GST reforms and their benefits to families

title: Maharaja’s College gears up for its 150-year celebrations
content: The plan includes programmes on the theme ‘Education and the Making of a Secular and Inclusive Kerala’, along with literary and folklore fests, seminars, and projects involving differently abled and transgender persons

title: Twenty20 chief raises allegations against CPI(M) leaders
content: Sabu M. Jacob accused two CPI(M) leaders in Ernakulam of having collected money from him in the past without issuing receipt

title: Government deliberating on questions of radioactive waste, private sector’s role in proposed nuclear bill
content: An official says deliberations are also on over questions such as who will be responsible for safe disposal of nuclear waste as well as the re-processing of spent nuclear fuel, and on enabling R&D of core nuclear technologies.

title: As allegations mount, KC(M) chooses to remain silent on Sabarimala row
content: Well aware of the potential political fallout, party chairman Jose K. Mani has chosen to maintain a studied silence on the issue

title: High time that court kept its hands off in matters related to sports, including cricket: Supreme Court
content: The petitioner’s counsel said the country is obsessed with cricket. The bench expressed its disinclination to entertain the plea.

title: Kargil war veteran inaugurates Podalakur road in Nellore
content: The 5 km-stretch of CC road from Batwadipalem to Dycus Road, along with divider, central lighting, drain and greenery development work in Nellore Rural constituency was built at a cost of ₹11 crore

title: Police should be thanked for the handling of Karur stampede, says Kamal Haasan
content: Commending Chief Minister M.K. Stalin’s handling of the situation, the MNM leader says, “The Chief Minister has shown exemplary leadership in a dignified manner. We are proud of it.”

title: HC extends suspension of toll collection at Paliyekkara, slams move to increase toll rate
content: The High Court suspended toll collection since August 6 following complaints regarding safety concerns and the shoddy condition of service roads through which vehicles are being diverted

title: Bhumana faults TTD Chairman over ‘Parivattam’ row
content: Former TTD chief criticises B.R. Naidu for sending Veda pundits to honour the Additional Executive Officer Ch. Venkaiah Chowdary with a ‘Parivattam’ on the occasion of his deceased father’s ‘Peddakarma’

title: VSP capacity utilisation rose significantly in one year: CM
content: Production capacity increased from 25% in September last year to 79% now, says Chandrababu Naidu and directs officials to ensure that it reaches 92.5% by the end of the third quarter

title: Lokesh pitches Andhra Pradesh as investment hub to Tata Group, global majors
content: IT & HRD Minister meets top industry leaders in Mumbai, inviting Tata Group, HP, ESR, and others to invest in manufacturing, renewable energy, logistics, and township projects in A.P.

title: Kerala Scrap Merchants Association to take out rally in Thiruvananthapuram on October 8
content: They are seeking full tax exemption on waste under GST and withdrawal of LSGD’s proposal to allocate recyclable waste materials exclusively to Haritha Karma Sena.

title: Anganwadi workers to help verify identity of burqa-clad voters at booths: CEC on Bihar polls
content: Bihar BJP president Dilip Jaiswal had on October 4, urged the Election Commission to ensure that faces of women turning up at booths in burqas were tallied with voter cards

title: In Kerala’s hilly regions, farmers battle the smaller wildlife
content: At an ongoing mitigation drive of the Forest dept. in Idukki, Kottayam, Pathanamthitta, and Ernakulam, most of the 1,255 complaints received hitherto pertain to attack on farmlands by animals such as Bonnet Macaques, Malabar Giant Squirrels, and wild pigs. The damage these small animals inflict on crops is enormous, complain farmers. There were only a few complaints about wild elephants, leopards and tigers

title: No supply of contaminated cough syrup in Andhra Pradesh, says Health Minister
content: Health Minister Satya Kumar Yadav directs officials to ensure that liquid medicines for cold and cough are not prescribed for children below two years

title: SIT report on Gaurav Gogoi and family’s link with Pakistan ‘damaging and damning’: Assam CM Sarma
content: The report was discussed informally in the Cabinet meeting on Monday (October 6, 2025), and ‘‘we will make it public later before journalists, including those from Delhi’‘, Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said

title: Teppotsavam to be introduced at Srisailam temple
content: The event will be held on November 18 in waters of river Krishna, near the Patalaganga, for the first time this year, according to temple executive officer

title: ‘EC-BJP gathbandhan’: Congress’ swipe at poll body after Bihar election dates announced
content: Chief Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar on Monday (October 6) announced two-phase Assembly elections in Bihar on November 6 and 11 while the counting of votes will be held on November 14

title: Ensure 25 paise interest loans for higher, foreign studies, Naidu tells officials
content: Chief Minister suggested that there should be no cap on the number of beneficiaries and repayment tenure should be 14 years

title: Nation forced to endorse religion every day, and it creates a sense of fear: Marathi Playwright, threatre director Satish Alekar
content: ‘Every day we have been reminded that we belong to Hindu dharma. I am a born Hindu, we followed Hindu rituals at my home. Earlier, we were never asked about religion’

title: RSS route march attracts more participants during centenary year celebrations
content: The annual Pathasanchalan sees overwhelming participation with several hundreds of members taking out the route march in Hubballi

title: Watch: Israel pounds Hamas 'terror squads' in Gaza
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . join us on a journey across continents as we unravel the stories that shape our interconnected world .

title: UFC 320 fight grades: A really good main card saves an otherwise mediocre slate
content: pereira's first-round knockout over Magomed Ankalaev was a tale of two fight cards . the main card featured a sure-to-be banger between Khalil Rountree Jr. and Ji Procházka .

title: Sorting out the bowl picture after another weekend of surprises
content: two preseason college football playoff contenders lost to opponents who had disappointed . last season's inaugural 12-team CFP, the five highest-ranked conference champions will make the field . the other eight teams will meet in first-round games at the campus sites of seeds Nos. 5 through 8 .

title: Power Rankings: Penn State drops out of Top 25 as three new teams join the list
content: Memphis' Cortez Braham Jr. hauls in a one-handed touchdown grab to increase the Tigers' lead against Tulsa . the Buckeyes offense has been more potent as of late, but there are areas to improve, just like there are with many units . a new group of standout quarterbacks has emerged, including Oregon 's Dante Moore and Ole Miss' Trinidad Chambliss .

title: Your guide to the Aces going up 2-0 against the Mercury in the 2025 WNBA Finals
content: the no. 2 Las Vegas Aces beat the Phoenix Mercury 91-78 in Game 2 of the 2025 WNBA Finals . Jackie Young had 32 points while four-time MVP A'ja Wilson had 28 points and 14 rebounds . despite a quiet scoring performance, Alyssa Thomas passed Courtney Vandersloot to become the all-time leader in postseason assists .

title: 'Angered every Indian': PM Modi speaks to CJI after shoe attack; applauds his calm
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: WWE Crown Jewel: Key stats and info to know before Saturday's premium live event
content: the premium live event (PLE) will be headlined by a pair of matches for the men's and women's crown jewel championships . undisputed WWE champion Cody Rhodes will challenge world heavyweight champion seth Rollins in one match .

title: 🏒 NHL season preview: X factors for all 32 teams
content: the opening night of the 2025-26 NHL season is Tuesday . this preview will serve you all the key intel you need on all 32 teams, including strengths, weaknesses, X factors, most likely award winners, fantasy tips and a bold prediction . the weekly rankings are formulated through votes from ESPN hockey broadcasters, analysts and reporters.
